You are actually asking for proof that co2 has increased due to burning fossil fuels?
What do you think happens to that co2? 
Does it magically disappear?

The half-life of CO2 is 39 years.  So it does "magically disappear."  

Man's contribution to atmospheric CO2 is ~ 35 billion tons per year.  natural sources produce around 1400 billion tons.  That makes man's contribution about 2.5%.  

Water vapor is responsible for ~ 95% of atmospheric warming per year, CO2 accounts for around 4% of atmospheric warming.  So man's contribution to atmospheric warming is 2.5% of 4%.  That makes man's contribution to atmospheric warming only 0.1%  That insignificant 0.1% contribution to "climate change" is what the left-wing extremist enviro-terrorists want us to embrace.  That's why the climate change gang refuses to debate the facts.  

So putting it gently, the entire man-made climate change narrative is not about science, not about facts, not about math.  It's all about control and lining the pockets of the climate change priests with money.    IT'S ALL ABOUT THE MONEY.

No it doesn't. It doesn't "disappear" at all. It might get absorbed by the sea but the seas ability to absorb Co2 is limited by it's temperature. 
The seas are constantly releasing their Co2 so that's just a cycle.
It's already saturated with Co2 in the form of carbonic acid.
Which is why we have "ocean acidification" and the "carbon sink" of the oceans, but that's not a permanent "sink".
If you look at the entire climate and ecosphere, Co2 goes nowhere, it just switches places.
It's carbon molecule might get absorbed by a tree, but then it's released from that tree when it decomposes or is burnt.
The only way that carbon is removed from the climate is by the formation of rocks, of the oil reserves and plate subduction that drags dead life back into the mantle.

So putting it gently, you need to learn less from social media.
"The half-life of CO2 is 39 years."
I don't know where you heard that, but a google search takes me straight to Euan Means blog, who is a science denier.
It's actually an estimate of how long an individual Co2 molecule might stay in the atmosphere, but as I've explained, that's irrelevant and quite misleading, despite being accurate. 

That water-vapor argument is also misleading.
Water vapor is caused by evaporation and so is proportional to the temperature of the atmosphere.
But changes to that are determined by Co2 (and to a smaller extent methane). 
So it's Co2 change that drives the greenhouse effect.

Do you have ANY CLUE what half-life it?  The molecule no longer exists.  it's components, Oxygen and Carbon are cycled back.  There is no NEW carbon on the planet, just what was there for billions of years.  

Carbon, by itself is a requirement of life.  What is present in our atmosphere from all sources is a tiny insignificant amount compared to what is present in the natural life on the planet.
